title: Northwest end of Hyde Street Pier Closed for Construction Activity
description: To maintain public safety during the Alma Floating Dock Replacement Project, the Northwest end of Hyde Street Pier will be closed for construction activity from November 15, 2022 to December 18, 2022.

title: Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season
description: The full backcountry vehicle route is closed for the winter season. Backcountry vehicle access is now limited to the Cabin District.

title: Weather Closure
description: Flight 93 will be closing today at 4:30 PM due to extreme winter weather and reopen tomorrow Wednesday, November 16 at 10:00am. Please check back for updates.

title: Night Sky Program Cancelled for Friday November 18th
description: Due to impending cold temperatures, the Night Sky Program for Friday November 18th has been cancelled

title: Capulin Volcano temporarily closed 11/15/2022
description: Due to icy and snowy conditions, Volcano Road and the Visitor Center will remain closed this morning, November 15th 2022. Volcano Road will open as soon as conditions improve tomorrow.

title: Naval Live Oaks Youth Campground Closure
description: The Naval Live Oak Youth Campground will be closed for repairs. This site is still open for day use of hiking trails.

title: Other Closures
description: All the park's drive-in campgrounds are closed for the season. All vault toilets in the park have been shut down, except at Sand Point and Grand Sable Visitor Center parking lot. Flush toilet at Munising Falls remains open.

title: Chancellorsville Battlefield Visitor Center Temporarily Closed
description: For staff and visitor safety, the Chancellorsville Battlefield Visitor Center is temporarily closed until further notice. We will provide updates as soon as possible.

title: The Cave Elevator is Closed
description: Due to mechanical issues the cave elevator is closed until further notice. During this time we are unable to offer the Accessible Tour. This only affects the Accessible Tour.

title: Antietam Battlefield Visitor Center Partially Closed
description: The park is operating out of a temporary visitor center while the permanent one undergoes rehabilitation. We expect to complete the project Spring 2023. Restrooms, exhibits and the park store are open daily from 9a -5p.

title: Park Visitor Center Operations to be at Dover Hotel "Surrender House" Tuesday and Thursday
description: The Visitor Center and ranger services will be held at the Dover Hotel/“Surrender House,”, located at 101 Petty Street, Dover, on Tuesday, November 15, and Thursday, November 17. Visitor services are available 9:00 am - 4:00 pm.

title: North Rim Open for Day Use Only. —Tuesday, November 15, 2022
description: Grand Canyon Lodge, food services, general store and North Rim Campground are closed for the winter. Travel with enough food and water for everyone in your group. NORTH RIM SCENIC ROAD to CAPE ROYAL is CLOSED FOR THE WINTER.

title: What's Closed, and What's Open This Week? —Tuesday, November 15, 2022
description: Coconino County is in CDC LOW Community Level — Face Masks Are Not Required indoors or on park shuttle buses. View the updated list of what's closed, and what's open this weekend. South Rim Visitor Center is open from 10 am to 4 pm.

title: Oversnow Camping off-limits
description: Oversnow camping is off-limits at the South West Campground due to present Dixie fire hazards. Alternate oversnow camping is available on National Forest land, and Morgan Summit Winter area.

title: Park operations due to COVID-19 – some locations remain closed
description: Many park areas have reopened, but confined spaces remain closed. More information can be found on our Alerts & Conditions page.

title: Municipal Pier at Aquatic Park is closed until further notice due to safety concerns.
description: After a safety review with the U.S. Public Health Service, it was determined that the deterioration of Municipal Pier in Aquatic Park Cove is unsafe for public use. Municipal Pier will remain closed until permanent, long-term repairs can be made.

title: Main Road Status
description: The Main Road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18). The road to Fairyland Point is currently closed. Fairyland Loop can be accessed at Sunrise Point.

title: Skyline Drive status
description: For the most up-to-date information about Skyline Drive status and conditions in the Park, opt in to our alert system. Text SHENALERTS to 888777.

title: Stonecliff Trail and Campground Closure
description: The Stonecliff Campground and Trail will be closed Tuesday November 14 through Thursday, November 17 for hazardous tree removal.

title: Boy Scout Trail: Temporary Closure
description: Nov 14th. We will be replacing a hiker's bridge on this trail, and the trail will be closed at the 1.5 mile mark until at least Thursday December 1st.

title: Monsoonal Damage Road Closures
description: Kelbaker Rd. between Baker and Kelso CLOSED; Wild Horse Canyon Rd. CLOSED to through traffic; Black Canyon Rd. CLOSED Mojave Road IMPASSIBLE in Paiute Gorge - detour available

title: Wild Horse Canyon & Black Canyon Roads CLOSED to Through Traffic
description: No through access on Wild Horse Canyon Rd; Wild Horse Canyon Rd is open at Mid Hills Campground only and closed at Black Canyon Rd. near Hole-in-the-Wall. Black Canyon Rd is closed from Hole-in-the-Wall to the junction of Wild Horse Canyon Rd.

title: Road Closed
description: South Rim Road beyond the Visitor Center is currently closed due to snow. East Portal Road is closed for the season. North Rim Road is currently open but will not be plowed.

title: No Winter Maintenance on Battlefield Trail
description: The battlefield trail will remain open, but will receive no winter maintenance. There may be ice or snow on the trail. Please walk with caution.

title: Cedar Grove is Closed for the Season
description: Highway 180 to Cedar Grove is now closed at the Hume gate until spring 2023.

title: Current Mask Policy in Visitor Center - week of November 13, 2022
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas at a LOW COVID-19 community level, masks are optional for visitors to Little Rock Central High School NHS, regardless of vaccination status, inside all park buildings.

title: Riverside Trail to Hot Springs CLOSED
description: Recent river flooding has damaged the riverside trail to the Hot Springs. The historic area and upper trail remain open, but the riverside trail to the springs is closed until further notice. Access the hot spring via the upper loop trail (3/4 mile).

title: North Pole Limited Tickets
description: The "North Pole Limited" event is organized by the Iron Horse Society, Steamtown's official Friends Group. Tickets are available at https://www.theironhorsesociety.com/santa

title: The Green River Ferry Is Open to Vehicle Traffic, But..
description: The Green River Ferry is open to vehicle traffic but still closed to trailers and recreational vehicles due to low water conditions. The closure will last until the river depth increases to safe levels to transport vehicles.

title: 11/17/22 No Guided Tour & Limited Staff Availability
description: On Thursday, 11/17/22 there will be limited staff availability - the 2:00 PM guided tour is canceled & the portable toilets may be closed. For self-guided Mill Mile tour information, click "more."

title: Face Masks Optional: Nov 11, 2022 Status Update
description: The NPS updated its masking guidance based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Steamtown NHS currently resides in a "MEDIUM" COVID-19 community level area. Masks are optional indoors and on train rides.

title: CA 190 Now Open Through Park - Some Other Park Roads Remain Closed
description: Many roads remain closed due to damage and debris from major flooding this summer. However, CA Highway 190, most popular visitor locations and the Furnace Creek Visitor Center are open. Click 'more' for a map and detailed information.

title: Face Masks are Optional at Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park
description: The COVID-19 community levels in Blanco and Gillespie Counties are currently LOW. Face masks are optional.

title: Temporary closure of a portion of the LBJ Ranch — Monday, November 14, 2022
description: Part of the LBJ Ranch will be closed on November 14, 9am - 1pm. This will allow for construction work on the taxiway. Facilities impacted include Show Barn, Hangar Visitor Center, Western National Parks Association store, and Texas White House Complex.

title: Howland Hill Road: Partial Closure on Nov. 16
description: On Nov. 16 Howland Hill Road from the west entrance (Crescent City) will be closed all day for maintenance. The east entrance from Hwy 199 will remain open to the public where you can drive as far as the Boy Scout Trailhead.

title: Beach Hazards Statement is in effect from 10 am on Sunday, Nov. 13 until 10 am on Monday, Nov. 14.
description: The NWS has issued a Beach Hazards Statement for the Coastal North Bay, including Point Reyes, for increased risk of sneaker waves and strong rip currents. Be extra careful & vigilant if visiting area beaches. Never turn your back to the sea.

title: Park Closure Due to Hurricane Nicole
description: The following areas will partially open Monday, November 14, 2022: Apollo Beach (Boardwalks #2, 3 & 4-stair access only, Eldora Road open.)

title: Public docking prohibited temporarily.
description: Update 11/12/22: Dock inspections found damage to docks and gangways. Public docking on the island at Sea Camp and Dungeness is prohibited until repairs are made. Plum Orchard dock is open. The ferry is operating. Please call with questions 912 882 4336.

title: Men's Restroom Closed at Fort Sumter
description: Currently the men's restroom is closed. Restrooms are available at Liberty Square and on the ferry boat. The boat remains docked at the fort while visitors are ashore.

title: Prince William Forest RV Campground will be closed starting November 1, 2022
description: Due to infrastructure improvements, the concession operated RV campground off of Hwy 234 will be closed until June 2023. Limited stay RV sites are available at Oak Ridge Campground for RVs under 30 feet with no hook-ups available.

title: Nature Center will be CLOSED on 11/17/2022
description: Rock Creek Park Nature Center will be closed to the public on November 17th. It will re-open at 9:00 AM on November 18th.

title: Echo and Hole in the Wall now open- Roadside camping permit required
description: Echo Canyon (to Eye of the Needle) and Hole in the Wall Roads have reopened. A free permit is now required to camp along these roads. No permit required for day use. Click below for more information.

title: Holiday Closures
description: Fort Union National Monument will be closed on Thanksgiving Day (November 24), Christmas Day and New Year's Day.

title: Hurricane Nicole Closure
description: Following the clean-up after Hurrican Nicole, the park will reopen to visitors Saturday November 12th, at 9am

title: Closed Areas
description: Due to Hurricane Nicole, the area around the Vehicle Ramp and much of our Oceanside boardwalk received significant damage. Those areas and associated parking lots are closed until further notice. For your safety please DO NOT attempt to access these areas

title: Covid-19 Information
description: Norfolk County is currently LOW (green) for community transmission based on the CDC's COVID-19 Community Levels tool. At this time, masks are not required in park buildings. Park staff and visitors may chose to wear masks at their own discretion.

title: Bainbridge Island Japanese American Exclusion Memorial partial closure
description: (Bainbridge Island, Washington) The Japanese American Exclusion Memorial "story wall" is inaccessible through 12/16/2022 while the City of Bainbridge Island performs maintenance on their well. The interpretive pavilion and departure deck remain accessible

title: Minidoka Visitor Center Closed for the Season
description: The Minidoka Visitor Center is closed until Summer 2023. Self-guided walking trails remain open daily. Brochures and passport stamps are available outside the visitor center at the After Hours box. Restrooms are unavailable.

title: Face masks are not required.
description: Community transmission level is currently at LOW or MEDIUM: Mask wearing is optional for staff, visitors, or others, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Masks are optional in Thomas Edison Historical Park buildings
description: As of November 11, 2022, Essex County New Jersey has become an area of MEDIUM risk and transmission. As such, masks are now optional at Thomas Edison NHP.
